document.docAuthor: González, Christian R., Elgueta, Mario & Ramirez, Francisco
document.masterDocTitle: A catalog of Acroceridae (Diptera) from Chile

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: A catalog of Acroceridae (Diptera) from Chile

subSubSection.paragraph:
Type species,
Musca gibbosa Linnaeus, 1758
; by subsequent monotypy by Latreille, 1802 (species cited as
Syrphus
).

paragraph.treatmentCitationGroup:
=
Henops Illiger, 1798
. Type species:
Musca gibbosa Linnaeus, 1758
; by monotypy.
Latreille, 1802 : 432
(synonymy).

=
Henops
Meigen, 1803 : 266
(preoccupied by Illiger, 1798 ). Type species:
Syrphus gibbosus Fabricius
(=
Musca gibbosa Linnaeus, 1758
); by monotypy.
Meigen, 1804 : 150
.
Coquillett, 1910 : 550
.

=
Thersites
Philippi, 1871 : 292
(preoccupied by
Pfeiffer, 1855 : 141
(Mollusca);
Bate, 1856 : 59
(Crustacea); Bate, 1857 ; 271 (Crustacea);
Pagenstecher, 1861 : 118
(Crustacea)). Type species:
Thersites jacobaeus Philippi, 1871
; by monotypy.

=
Thersitomyia
Hunter, 1901 : 152
. Replacement name for
Thersites Philippi, 1871
. Type species:
Thersites jacobaeus Philippi, 1871
; by monotypy.
Hunter, 1901 : 152
(cat.);
Kertész, 1909 : 21
(cat.);
Edwards, 1930 : 188
(in key);
Hennig, 1968 : 3
–4 (as possible synonym of
Ogcodes
).

subSubSection.paragraph:
Holotype: male, without date (cited as deposited in C. Stuardo Collection, actually at MNNC but it is not deposited in this last institution and it is not at USNM, presumably lost).
Paratype : male, Panguipulli. Dist. : Los Ríos ( Valdivia : Panguipulli ).

paragraph.treatmentCitationGroup:
Thersites jacobaeus
Philippi, 1871 : 292
. Syntypes : female, male, Santiago province ( NMW but actually lost; according to
Hennig (1968: 3)
, the type specimen is not deposited in this institution). Dist: Metropolitana ( Santiago : without precise locality).

subSubSection.paragraph: Comments: Hennig (1968) indicates erroneously that this species was described by a single female, but Philippi (1871: 293) give measurements for a female specimen and indicate that “Das Männchen ist halb so gross wie das Weibchen, sonst nicht wesentlich verschieden” (= The male is half the size of the female, otherwise not essentially different). Clearly, Philippi (1871) had at least one female and one male, and then both are syntypes .
Holotype : male, Viña del Mar ( INHS ), female unknown. Dist.: Valparaíso ( Valparaíso : Quintero, Viña del Mar).

Holotype: male, Malloco (cited as deposited in C. Stuardo Collection, actually at MNNC but it is not deposited in this last institution and it is not at USNM, too. Presumably lost). Dist.: Santiago (Talagante: Malloco). Refs.: Stuardo, 1946 : 103 (cat.); Schlinger, 1960 : 276 (key), 314 (dist., comments).
